title: Klee (Leon Amiel Art Ebook).pdf
description:
Klee
Leon Amiel Publisher | 1974 | ISBN: 0814805892 | English | 142 pages | PDF | 22.8 MB

Paul Klee died in 1940 without his work being fully appreciated for its depth, beauty, intricacy and theoretical soundness as modern art. Klee during his lifetime, was better known for his teaching than for his artistic work. He was an impassioned teacher and left a large body of theoretical work and notes on artistic techniques. This short book of plates of some of his most famous work is a beautiful summary of how his work captures the primitive as well as the alien. It is rich, in both the foreground and the background, that is to say, rather than being completely spontaneous it is well planned and well-thought out: like a mathematician or geometer equations. Yet, most of his work looks spontaneous and fresh
